entry.title: Brazil Legalizes Crypto as a Method of Payment
entry.summary: Paying for goods and services with crypto will be legal—but crypto is still not legal tender.

entry.title: SBF Hid Republican Donations So Media Wouldn't 'Freak the Fuck Out'
entry.summary: Bankman-Fried became the poster boy for "effective altruism" but only donated publicly to Democratic candidates.

entry.title: What’s Happening With Wrapped Bitcoin on Ethereum?
entry.summary: Wrapped Bitcoin—WBTC—lost its peg last week. Here's what that means, and why it matters.

entry.title: DeFi Giants Aave, Compound Freeze Markets and Cap Loans to Mitigate Risks
entry.summary: The lending protocols have implemented new security measures to block attacks after an attempted short squeeze last week.

entry.title: OpenSea CEO: FTX Fallout Is ‘Opportunity’ to Refocus on Trust
entry.summary: The NFT marketplace head points to the benefits of decentralization and talks about creator royalties in the Solana NFT market.

entry.title: Fintech Lawyer Says Crypto Companies Should Seek Legal Advice Before Launch
entry.summary: Lisa Rubin, a blockchain attorney with Paul Hastings, sat down with Decrypt at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco to discuss legal misconceptions the industry still holds.

entry.title: Ethereum Founder Vitalik Buterin Calls Governance Token Speculation ‘Pathological’
entry.summary: Buterin doesn’t want traders to speculate on or hoard crypto governance tokens.

entry.title: FTX, Alameda Owe BlockFi More Than $1 Billion: Court Hearing
entry.summary: "The Luna collapse really was the start of everything," lead attorney Joshua Sussberg said during the company's first day hearing.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Says FTX Hacker May Be a Former Employee
entry.summary: The bankrupt FTX cofounder also admitted in an interview published today that he prioritized Bahamian withdrawals.

entry.title: Coinbase Wallet Delists XRP, Bitcoin Cash and Ethereum Classic
entry.summary: America’s biggest crypto exchange has scrapped a number of assets from its self-custody mobile app citing waning customer interest.

entry.title: ApeCoin Up 31% as Staking Nears, Bored Ape NFT Prices Rebound
entry.summary: The Ethereum-based token is surging following the release of final staking details and the official ApeCoin NFT marketplace rollout.

entry.title: Could Bitcoin Crash to $10,000? Market Experts Weigh In
entry.summary: With the FTX contagion still at work, investors are now asking what's in store for Bitcoin as the crypto bear market deepens.

entry.title: Phantom Co-founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt to discuss the history of Phantom and what he’s looking forward to in Web3

entry.title: Phantom Solana Wallet Adds Support for Ethereum and Polygon
entry.summary: The popular wallet for the Solana blockchain is expanding to include two rival proof-of-stake blockchains.

entry.title: 'Bitcoin Senator' Lummis: FTX Collapse Shows 'It's Time' for Congress to Learn About Crypto
entry.summary: Lummis said that her bipartisan crypto bill could serve as a "framework" for looking at how the collapse of FTX could have been prevented.

entry.title: Play Casual Games, Win NFTs: Burn Ghost Raises $3.1M for Gaming Platform
entry.summary: The startup seeks to expand Web3 adoption via easy-to-play games that reward winners with NFT collectibles.

entry.title: Crypto Remains Largest Investment Sector in 2022, Outpacing Fintech And Biotech
entry.summary: Funding for crypto developer teams in Mysten Labs and Aptos Labs have lead DeFi and Web 3 deal-making in Q3 this year.

entry.title: Bankrupt BlockFi Suing FTX Founder Over Robinhood Shares Promised as Collateral: Report
entry.summary: SBF allegedly promised his stake in Robinhood as collateral to help the now-bankrupt crypto lender BlockFi through its liquidity issues.

entry.title: Dogecoin Jumps 8% Overnight, Continuing Two-Week Rally
entry.summary: Dogecoin, the world’s most popular meme coin, is still beating the odds in the largely sideways cryptocurrency market.

entry.title: FTX Resumes Post-Bankruptcy Payments to Employees
entry.summary: The company will pay employees and vendors, but not former CEO Sam Bankman-Fried or Caroline Ellison.

entry.title: Gary Vee-Backed NFT Startup Candy Digital Cuts Staff in Mass Layoffs
entry.summary: The company, valued at $1.5 billion, is backed by Fanatics and was co-founded by Gary Vaynerchuk and Mike Novogratz.

entry.title: Biggest Outflows in 12 Weeks as Investors Cash Out Following FTX Fall
entry.summary: A new CoinShares report suggests that investors continue to feel bearish following the FTX crash.

entry.title: Crypto Exchange Kraken Settles With Treasury Department Over Iran Sanctions Violations
entry.summary: U.S. regulators continue their crusade against the lack of sanction compliance among crypto exchanges.

entry.title: Executive Who Brought Time Magazine Into Web3 Is Leaving for MoonPay
entry.summary: Longtime media executive Keith Grossman is departing to join the crypto payments startup to help more companies enter Web3.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Slide Lower With Stocks Amid China Unrest, Crypto Contagion Fears
entry.summary: Markets appear to have been rattled by COVID protests in China. BlockFi’s bankruptcy announcement hasn’t helped either.

entry.title: BlockFi Owes $1 Billion to Just Three of Its Largest Creditors: Bankruptcy Filing
entry.summary: The largest creditors include the trustee company that manages its BlockFi Interest Accounts, FTX US, and the SEC.

entry.title: Deadmau5’s Pixelynx Unveils NFT Scavenger Hunt: ‘Rock Band Meets Pokémon Go’
entry.summary: The Elynxir music metaverse game from Deadmau5 and Richie Hawtin comes to life in Miami this week through augmented reality.

entry.title: Crypto Lender BlockFi Filing for Bankruptcy and Conducting Major Layoffs as FTX Contagion Claims Another: Source
entry.summary: BlockFi is the latest crypto firm to file for bankruptcy following the collapse of Sam Bankman-Fried's crypto empire.

entry.title: Line to Shutter US Crypto Exchange Next Year, Suspends Onboarding Today
entry.summary: The Japanese social media firm Line will shutter its American crypto exchange, adding that the decision was unrelated to FTX’s collapse.

entry.title: Dogecoin Jumps 22% in a Week Amid Twitter Payments Speculation
entry.summary: The meme coin’s latest bull run may be related to the speculation that it could be involved in Elon Musk’s plans for Twitter.

entry.title: 'Shrimp' and 'Crab' Bitcoin Balances Hit Record Highs Amid FTX Collapse
entry.summary: Retail Bitcoin holders have been aggressively accumulating the leading cryptocurrency since the implosion of the FTX exchange.

entry.title: Why NFTs Had to Be Invented
entry.summary: Everything ever invented came into existence in order to solve a problem. In the case of NFTs, they were created to address the limitations of their predecessors, which were created on the Bitcoin blockchain.

entry.title: Attorney General of The Bahamas Defends Its Crypto Savvy in Wake of FTX Crash
entry.summary: Ryan Pinder's years in public service included a year-long break to work at Deltec Bank, a Bahamanian firm with ties to FTX.

entry.title: Crypto Cyber Monday Deals for Your Shopping List
entry.summary: Hardware wallets are a popular option for securing digital assets, and blockchain intelligence firms are also offering deals.

entry.title: Would-Be Crypto Sleuths Converge on Bahamas to Hunt for SBF
entry.summary: The crypto community takes the search for the disgraced FTX founder into their own hands.

entry.title: 5 Lessons From the Stunning Implosion of SBF and FTX
entry.summary: SBF went from crypto hero to zero in a few ruinous days. The contagion and reputational damage for the industry is brutal. Can we learn from it?

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Genesis in the Spotlight as FTX Shockwaves Subside
entry.summary: Also, the Ethereum team wanted everyone to know that fees on the network may soon be reduced by as much as 100x.

entry.title: CME Head Appears To Say He Bribed CTFC Official
entry.summary: Terry Duffy made the slip while speaking to Tucker Carlson on Fox News.

entry.title: Crypto Marketers Search for a New Sales Pitch After FTX Crisis
entry.summary: As the FTX contagion continues, crypto marketers are scrambling to sell a more appealing vision of the industry—and reassure a wary public.

entry.title: Aave Feeling the Squeeze Even After Failed Attempt by Mango Hacker
entry.summary: The trader who exploited Mango Market failed to do the same on Aave. But he did prove a point, and left Aave with $1.6 million in bad debt.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin, Ethereum Stable—Has the Worst of the FTX Damage Passed?
entry.summary: It looks like the worst may be over for now, though a CoinShares report suggests institutional players are lining up to short crypto.

entry.title: What Is Web3 and What Is Its Role in NFTs?
entry.summary: The internet is slowly evolving into its third iteration — Web3. How will NFTs be incorporated into the Web3 paradigm?

entry.title: NFT Storytelling: Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry, Artemysia-X, Kas Vegas at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: "Lost Children of Andromeda" author Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry of Metagood and ACTAI Ventures, Artemysia-X of Rug Radio program LorePlay, and Kas Vegas of NFT INT, Huxley, and Feature.io all discussed how their work utilizes NFTs for storytelling, on a lively panel at Camp Decrypt moderated by What's Trending podcast host Shira Lazar.

entry.title: Edward Snowden Talks Tornado Cash Sanctions, Ethereum Merge, DAOs and NFTs at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: In an extensive talk with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Decrypt in Napa CA in October, Edward Snowden gave his candid views on the Ethereum merge, the sanctioning of Ethereum mixer Tornado Cash by the U.S. government, the privacy shortcomings of Bitcoin and Ethereum, and his view on using DAOs to source tips from whistleblowers.

entry.title: The New Landscape for NFT Drops: Bad Grrls Creative Club, BeetsDAO, and Cymbal at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: Amid a crypto bear market and recent declines in NFT sales volume, what's the new roadmap for new NFT collections? What's expected by community members and collectors? Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club, Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO, and Eric Feng of NFT block explorer discussed with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Camp Decrypt Napa.

entry.title: Musician 3LAU on His Music NFT Platform Royal: 'We Take Compliance Really Seriously'
entry.summary: Justin Blau aka 3LAU, CEO of Royal, talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin about building his company around compliance from the start. "We take compliance so seriously that it might make us move a little bit slower... but we think that's really how we have to build in the space." He also said he looks to Coinbase as a model.

entry.title: FTX Meltdown 101: What the Hell Happened and What Comes Next
entry.summary: In less than a week, one of the largest and most trusted crypto exchanges went up in flames, along with its crypto celebrity founder and CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Kate Irwin walk you through exactly how it happened, what it means for you, their own takes on the most interesting subplots, and what we can learn from it all. Plus: We review some comments SBF and CZ made on this podcast that look remarkable in hindsight. Watch Episode 23 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Sun On the Future of Tron's USDD Stablecoin
entry.summary: The Tron founder tells Decrypt about the network's decentralized stablecoin USDD, and how Tron aims to "bridge the Web3 world with the real world.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: What Is A Blockchain API?
entry.summary: As the unsung heroes of digital connectivity, APIs are the engine under the hood making all the interactivity we’ve come to expect online possible. In video five of the Infura Web3 Dev Series, you’ll learn what blockchain APIs are, how they work, and explore the different types of APIs to improve your dapp’s connectivity. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Tech Writer at ConsenSys.

entry.title: When DAOs Meet NFTs: Zora, Chainlink, PubDAO and RugDAO at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: Rug Radio founder Farokh hosted a lively panel at Camp Decrypt Napa on how DAOs are utilizing NFTs, with panelists Lauren Halstead from Chainlink, Tyson Battistella from Zora, Reza Jafery from PubDAO, and Loxley from Rug Radio's associated RugDAO.

entry.title: How Stepn Plans to Keep Running Through the Bear Market
entry.summary: Stepn COO Shiti Manghani speaks to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at Solana Breakpoint in Lisbon to discuss how the move-to-earn app is weathering the bear market, its partnership with sportswear manufacturer Asics, and creator royalties on NFT marketplaces.

entry.title: Brave CEO Brendan Eich: Web3 Isn't Taking Privacy Seriously Enough
entry.summary: Brave founder and CEO Brendan Eich joined Decrypt's Stephen Graves at Web Summit 2022 to discuss how the crypto-powered browser is weathering the bear market—and why Web3 needs to get serious about privacy.

entry.title: The View from Rug Radio: Farokh Speaks at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: Farokh, founder of the DAO-governed NFT media brand Rug Radio, speaks to Mike Kriak of ConsenSys Mesh at Camp Decrypt: Napa. He talked about Rug Radio's origins, tokenization, sponsorship money during the bear market, and why it's called Rug Radio.

entry.title: gm: Aave Founder Stani Talks Stablecoins and Next Era of DeFi
entry.summary: Aave founder Stani Kulechov joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott to talk about his vision for the next iteration of DeFi, Aave V3 and Lens Protocol, the Web3 company he wishes he had founded, and why now is the right time for the $5B lending protocol to launch its GHO stablecoin. Watch Episode 22 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.
